page.title: 10MR.WILLIAM PETRIE OF RHU.
page.content: Mr. Petrie who owns the post office/ general store in Rhu has lived in the area all his life and has been a councillor for the past 19 years.He has seen many changes in the district but feels that the great increase in housing and population,which at approx.1600 is four times that of 50 years ago,is the most significant.At present he is involved in two major local issues:_1.The proposed expansion of the Clyde Submarine Base at Faslane for the Trident Development and the effect it will have on our village. 2.The planned new road through Rhu which will need careful consideration in order to preserve the beauty of the Bay.Mr. Petrie's main hope for Rhu is that it is not allowed to become so large that it would lose its identity and eventually become a suburb of the neighbouring town of Helensburgh.
